poem:
Six Names in Morning Light

The paper whispers their names,
a litany of loss—
Yagev, Alexander, Avraham,
Yoram, Nadav, Chaim.
Beneath Gaza's troubled skin,
tunnels offer no solace, no sunrise.
Six souls lifted from shadows,
their silence now a prayer,
a plea for peace
whispered in the heart of dawn.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wednesday briefing: What next for peace in Gaza after six Israeli hostages’ bodies are recovered Good morning. There were 115 Israeli hostages, dead and alive, left in Gaza; now there are 109. Yesterday, the Israel Defense Forces said that it had recovered the bodies of six civilians taken by Hamas on 7 October last year – Yagev Buchshtab, Alexander Dancyg, Avraham Munder, Yoram Metzger, Nadav Popplewell and Chaim Peri – from tunnels under the city". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
